etymologies: mid 18th century: modern Latin, named after M. de Poinci, a 17th-century governor of the Antilles

definitions: a tropical tree of the pea family, with showy red or red and yellow flowers.

notes.text: Genera Caesalpinia and Delonix (formerly Poinciana), family Leguminosae: several species, including the scarlet-flowered royal poinciana (D. regia), native to Madagascar

shortDefinitions: tropical tree of pea family, with showy red or red and yellow flowers
